original: Nasepia has an appearance similar to that of most other Erniettomorphs from Namibia, with it having a leaf-like body with thin ribs and spindle-shaped bodies, however it differentiates itself from other taxa such as Pteridinium and Rangea in the sense that it has smaller petaloids and with the configuration of the ribs being sub-parallel to its axis.

original: According to anonymous sources cited by The Wall Street Journal, FTX had lent $10 billion of its customer assets to Alameda Research in 2022, and Alameda CEO Caroline Ellison disclosed to other Alameda employees that she, Sam Bankman-Fried, Gary Wang, and Nishad Singh knew about that decision.
simplified: The Wall Street Journal reported that FTX had given Alameda Research $10 billion to buy some of its business, and that Alameda CEO Caroline Ellison had told other Alameda employees that she, Sam Bankman-Fried, Gary Wang, and Nishad Singh knew about the deal.

simplified: Anonymous sources reported to The Wall Street Journal that FTX lent $10 billion of its customer assets to Alameda Research in 2022. || Caroline Ellison, Alameda's CEO, told other Alameda employees that she, Sam Bankman-Fried, Gary Wang, and Nishad Singh were aware of this decision.

original: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom unanimously denies the Scottish government the right to hold a second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom denied Scotland the opportunity to hold a second vote for independence without approval from Britain.

original: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom unanimously denies the Scottish government the right to hold a second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom said that the government of Scotland had no right to hold a second referendum on independence without the permission of the British government.

original: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom unanimously denies the Scottish government the right to hold a second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.
simplified: The UK’s Supreme Court will not simply let the Scottish government hold a second election to decide if Scotland will become separate from the UK. || To hold such an election, the Scottish government will need the support of the British Government.

original: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom unanimously denies the Scottish government the right to hold a second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom ruled that the Scottish government could not hold another referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.

original: The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom unanimously denies the Scottish government the right to hold a second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom without approval from the British government.
